metadata.Title: CVE-2020-0034 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
In vp8_decode_frame of decodeframe.c, there is a possible out of bounds read due to improper input validation. This could lead to remote information disclosure if error correction were turned on, with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android-8.0 Android-8.1Android ID: A-62458770

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-0034` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvpx1 - 1.3.0-2ubuntu0.1~esm2
vpx-tools - 1.3.0-2ubuntu0.1~esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libvpx package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3.0-2ubuntu0.1~esm2').
